posts.text:
We're witnessing the highest rise of antisemitism in 50 years: Irwin Cotler on the global evil  https://nationalpost.com/news/world/israel-middle-east/highest-rise-of-antisemitism-in-50-years-irwin-cotler via @nationalpost

The responsibility for ending antisemitism and hate in all it's forms belongs to each of us.

quote.text:
It's happening already. They're shifting the story.

They're making this about Gaza, hoping you'll forget what happened just one week ago.

1,300 Israelisâ€”entire families, infants, the elderlyâ€”were massacred by Hamas.

That's the story. Everything must be seen through that lens.
quote.author: Avi Mayer

quote.text:
For all the misery, murder, and chaos across Israel & Gaza, Hamas is responsible.

There is no equivalence.

We stand with the reservists & security services bringing order to Israel by weeding out these terrorists and ensuring they're never capable of this again.
quote.author: Shuv Majumdar

posts.text:
Honoured to attend Pierre's speech on behalf of Parry Sound-Muskoka.

I have seen the beauty of Israel and the resilience of it's people firsthand.

Terrorists must not win. Israel has the right to defend itself and respond against the attackers.

quote.text:
In Jerusalem tonight, 224 pillars of light for each child, woman and man being held hostage by #Hamas in Gaza.  ðŸ’”

ðŸ“¸ Arnon Bosanni #BringThemHome
quote.author: CIJA

posts.text:
Hamas cannot be trusted to respect any ceasefire.

They are a terrorist group.

I continue to support Israel's right to defend itself and to take action to eliminate Hamas and bring home the hostages.

The conflict in Israel is centuries old and I just wish everybody could just step back and just say, you know what, this was an arid piece of dirt before Israel was established and started to apply technology and innovation and entrepreneurship to this land. You can tell where the border is between Israel and its neighbours, it's where the green ends.
Self-respecting nations that actually try to serve their people like Jordan, like Egypt, I mean they've made peace [with Israel].
And that hatred, from wherever you may have been from, does not belong here. It has no place here. It has no place anywhere in the world but if you're a Canadian, you're a Canadian!
posts.commentary: Aitchison continuing the implication of the article that the rise in support for Palestinians is hateful / antisemitic
